speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the field.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Alarum. Enter fighting, Soldiers of both armies; then BRUTUS, CATO, LUCILIUS, and others

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Yet, countrymen, O, yet hold up your heads!

speaker: CATO
text_entry: What bastard doth not? Who will go with me?

speaker: CATO
text_entry: I will proclaim my name about the field:

speaker: CATO
text_entry: I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho!

speaker: CATO
text_entry: A foe to tyrants, and my country's friend;

speaker: CATO
text_entry: I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho!

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: And I am Brutus, Marcus Brutus, I;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Brutus, my country's friend; know me for Brutus!

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: O young and noble Cato, art thou down?

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Why, now thou diest as bravely as Titinius;

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: And mayst be honour'd, being Cato's son.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: Yield, or thou diest.

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Only I yield to die:

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: There is so much that thou wilt kill me straight;

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Offering money

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Kill Brutus, and be honour'd in his death.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: We must not. A noble prisoner!

speaker: Second Soldier
text_entry: Room, ho! Tell Antony, Brutus is ta'en.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: I'll tell the news. Here comes the general.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: Enter ANTONY

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: Brutus is ta'en, Brutus is ta'en, my lord.

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: Where is he?

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Safe, Antony; Brutus is safe enough:

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: I dare assure thee that no enemy

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Shall ever take alive the noble Brutus:

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: The gods defend him from so great a shame!

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: When you do find him, or alive or dead,

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: He will be found like Brutus, like himself.

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: This is not Brutus, friend; but, I assure you,

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: A prize no less in worth: keep this man safe;

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: Give him all kindness: I had rather have

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: Such men my friends than enemies. Go on,

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: And see whether Brutus be alive or dead;

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: And bring us word unto Octavius' tent

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: How every thing is chanced.

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: Exeunt
